channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-116] Nesting DBRefs doesn't work > 1 layers
item.description:
Loading an Object that has a DBRef that has another DBRef throws an Exception.

Example with TestCase:

http://ethone.de/spring/mongodb-nested.zip

Exception:

org.springframework.core.convert.ConverterNotFoundException: No converter found capable of converting from 'com.mongodb.DBRef' to 'org.mongodb.samples.domain.NestedLevelOne'
at org.springframework.core.convert.support.GenericConversionService.convert(GenericConversionService.java:181)
at org.springframework.core.convert.support.GenericConversionService.convert(GenericConversionService.java:133)
at org.springframework.data.mapping.MappingBeanHelper.setProperty(MappingBeanHelper.java:170)
at org.springframework.data.mapping.MappingBeanHelper.setProperty(MappingBeanHelper.java:148)
at org.springframework.data.document.mongodb.convert.MappingMongoConverter$3.doWithAssociation(MappingMongoConverter.java:274)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I updated the dependency in your sample project to use 1.0.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT of spring-data-mongodb, fixed a couple of inconsistencies in the collection name on the @Document annotations in the test classes, and ran a mvn test. The test was successful.
